sentences.en: As I was looking through some books on a secondhand bookstall , I dropped on just what I wanted.
sentences.cn: 当我在旧书摊浏览书籍时, 我意外地找到了我所需要的书.

sentences.en: Do you know where I can get hold of a secondhand carpet cleaner?
sentences.cn: 你知道我在哪里可以弄到旧的地毯吸尘器 吗 ?

sentences.en: He had an immense collection of secondhand books.
He happened on the book in a secondhand bookstore.
sentences.cn: 他在旧书店里偶然发现了这本书.

sentences.en: I bought a secondhand chair which is as good as new.
sentences.cn: 我买了一把二手货椅子,它如同新的一样.
这本书是我以二手货买来的.

sentences.en: I lit upon a rare book in a secondhand bookshop.
sentences.cn: 我在一家旧书店里偶然发现一珍本书.

sentences.en: I only heard about it secondhand.
sentences.cn: 我只间接听说了这件事。

sentences.en: I picked up the book in a secondhand bookstore.
sentences.cn: 我在一家旧书店里偶获此书.

sentences.en: Is this camera new or secondhand?
sentences.cn: 这架照相机是新的还是旧的?
其他人捐赠了一些旧衣服。

sentences.en: Perhaps secondhand cares, like second - hand clothes, come easily off and on.
sentences.cn: 或许二等角色的责任, 正如二道手的衣服一样, 穿上脱下都比较随便吧.

sentences.en: The shop sells secondhand goods on commission.
They cost nine pounds new, three pounds secondhand.
They could afford a secondhand car, she thought.
sentences.cn: 他们能买得起一辆二手车，她想。

sentences.en: They sell new and secondhand computers.
sentences.cn: 他们卖新电脑和二手电脑.

sentences.en: This is a book I bought secondhand years ago.
sentences.cn: 这是我几年前买的一本旧书.

words.tran_cn: 间接地；间接听来；以旧货

trans.tran_cn: 旧的，用过的，二手的，<贬>（消息、信息等）间接得来的
trans.tran_en: Secondhand things are not new and have been owned by someone else

trans.tran_cn: 间接地；间接听来；以旧货
